alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 06 at 3:11AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Franklin, Leon, Liberty and Wakulla. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 311 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Carrabelle, Crawfordville, Eastpoint, Franklin, Sopchoppy, Sanborn, Poplar Camp, Curtis Mill, Smith Creek, Mcintyre, East Camp, Morgan Place, Buckhorn, Jewel Fire Tower, Lanark Village, Turkey Point, Medart and Arran. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
